    Download Arques v1.0.15 (latest)
    or
    View on GitHub
    Your help will affect its evolution

    ar

    ar singleton is the core singleton to use Arques Engine.

    Namespaces

    pref
    ar.pref

    valid
    ar.valid

    net
    ar.net

    dlg
    ar.dlg

    Members

    static w :integer

    Get the current width of the window.

    static h :integer

    Get the current height of the window.

    Methods

    static icon(name, sizeopt, styleopt)

    Returns html string of specified icon.

    Parameters:
    Name Type Attributes Description
    name string

    Icon name. Please refer to https://www.noblic.com/arques/samples/icons.html for the name.
    size integer <optional>

    Icon size. Default size is 24.
    style string <optional>

    CSS style string for coloring and etc.

    static color(color) → {string}

    Returns 'rgba(r,g,b,a)' string.

    Parameters:
    Name Type Description
    color integer

    Integer color value
    Returns:
    string -

    Returns 'rgba(r,g,b,a)' string

    static log()

    Prints a log in console.

    static logCS()

    Prints the callstack until this line.

    static osVer()

    Returns current OS version.

    static pad(num, size)

    Fills 0 as many as the size.

    Parameters:
    Name Type Description
    num integer

    number to be filled with '0'
    size integer

    number of digit

    static copy(object)

    Copies json object by using JSON.parse(JSON.stringify(o)).

    Parameters:
    Name Type Description
    object json

    Json object to be copied

    static cmpVer(src, dst) → {integer}

    Compares version string of A and B. String length must be same otherwise it returns the difference of the length.

    Parameters:
    Name Type Description
    src string

    Source version string
    dst string

    Destination version string
    Returns:
    integer -

    0 is identical and the other number is the difference

    static urlToHash(url) → {object}

    Parses url parameters and returns a hash structure.

    Parameters:
    Name Type Description
    url string

    URL to be parsed
    Returns:
    object -

    Returns a hash structure of parsed parameters

    static setAngleUnit(angleUnit)

    Sets the default global angle unit. You can choose an appropriate unit what you want to use for your project.

    Parameters:
    Name Type Description
    angleUnit integer

    Angle Unit. Use ar.DEGREE or ar.RADIAN.

    static setDomain(domain)

    Sets the default domain for networking. All network methods of Arques will use this domain.

    Parameters:
    Name Type Description
    domain string

    Default domain for networking

    static run(delay, cb) → {integer}

    Substitutes setTimeout.

    Parameters:
    Name Type Description
    delay integer

    Milliseconds to be delayed
    cb function

    Callback to be called after the delay
    Returns:
    integer -

    ID returned by setTimeout

    static isPrefix(source, prefix) → {boolean}

    Checks if source string has the specified prefix.

    Parameters:
    Name Type Description
    source string

    Source string to be checked
    prefix string

    Prefix string to check with
    Returns:
    boolean -

    Returns true if it's identical

    static isSuffix(source, suffix) → {boolean}

    Checks if source string has the specified suffix.

    Parameters:
    Name Type Description
    source string

    Source string to be checked
    suffix string

    Suffix string to check with
    Returns:
    boolean -

    Returns true if it's identical

    static tick() → {integer}

    Returns the number of milliseconds since midnight of January 1, 1970

    Returns:
    integer -

    Milliseconds

    static isValid(object) → {boolean}

    Is object defined and not null?

    Parameters:
    Name Type Description
    object object

    Object to be checked
    Returns:
    boolean -

    Returns true if the object is defined and not null.

    static str(id) → {string}

    Returns a string of specifed id for the current language

    Parameters:
    Name Type Description
    id string

    Text ID
    Returns:
    string -

    Returns the text of the specifed ID

    static strWidth(text, textClassopt, textStyleopt) → {integer}

    Returns pixel width of specified text.

    Parameters:
    Name Type Attributes Description
    text string

    Text
    textClass string <optional>

    CSS class name to measure with
    textStyle string <optional>

    CSS style text to measure with
    Returns:
    integer -

    Returns the width of the specifed text

    static strHeight(text, textClassopt, textStyleopt) → {integer}

    Returns pixel height of specified text.

    Parameters:
    Name Type Attributes Description
    text string

    Text
    textClass string <optional>

    CSS class name to measure with
    textStyle string <optional>

    CSS style text to measure with
    Returns:
    integer -

    Returns the height of the specifed text

    static uuid() → {string}

    Returns a new uuid.

    Returns:
    string -

    Returns 36 bytes uuid string

    static rand() → {string}

    Returns a random integer number between min and max.

    Returns:
    string -

    Returns 36 bytes uuid string

    static ymdHms(isHumanReadableopt) → {string}

    Returns the current time by format of YMDHMS.

    Parameters:
    Name Type Attributes Description
    isHumanReadable boolean <optional>
    Returns:
    string -

    Returns ymdHms string

    static toHex(Integer) → {string}

    Returns converted hex string(without '0x' prefix).

    Parameters:
    Name Type Description
    Integer integer

    number to be converted
    Returns:
    string -

    Returns the hex string

    static loop(callback)

    Loops callback until it returns false at intervals of 20ms

    Parameters:
    Name Type Description
    callback function

    static ani(opt)

    Runs animation.

    Parameters:
    Name Type Description
    opt object

    Specify object as below:
    {
    obj: object, // E_or_DOM object to be animated
    name: animationName, // please refer to https://daneden.github.io/animate.css/ for the name
    cb: function() {}, // callback is called after ar.css.aniTime milliseconds
    }

    static localPos(element, event)

    Returns local { x, y } of the event (mouse or touch) on E_or_DOM.

    Parameters:
    Name Type Description
    element object

    E_or_DOM object
    event object

    A mouse event object or a touch event object

    static setStyle(url)

    Prepares to load a custom style. Use this methond to change the default dialog style.

    Parameters:
    Name Type Description
    url string

    A css file url to be loaded

    static setLang(langCode, url)

    Prepares to load a language string set from the specifed language code and the url.

    Parameters:
    Name Type Description
    langCode string

    User defined language code
    url string

    A Language javasript url to be loaded
    Example
    A language file is like below:

ar.lang.add('en', { // Define a language code and use <b>ar.lang.add</b> method to register a string set of the language
  greeting: 'Hello',
});

    static add(langCode, json)

    Adds the current language string set for the language code.

    Parameters:
    Name Type Description
    langCode string

    User defined language code
    json object

    Json string set of the language code

    static on(element, name, handler)

    Installs an event handler to the centralized event controller.

    Parameters:
    Name Type Description
    element object

    E or DOM element
    name object

    Event name
    handler function

    Event handler function

    static off(element, name)

    Uninstalls an event handler from the centralized event controller.

    Parameters:
    Name Type Description
    element object

    E or DOM element
    name object

    Event name

    static click(scope, element, opt)

    Installs a click event.

    Parameters:
    Name Type Description
    scope Scope

    Scope object for the click event handler
    element object

    E or DOM element
    opt object

    Options for the click event handler as below:
    {
    'no-pointer', // specify if it will use default cursor, otherwise the default cursor(hand pointer) will be used
    'click-class': string, // class name to change the background when it's clicked
    'click-color': string, // color vale to change the background when it's clicked
    'click': string, // specify the function name of the scope object to be called when it's clicked
    cb: function() {}, // callback function to be called when it's clicked. 'click' handler will not be called if this is specified
    }

    static has(id)

    Checks if the DOM element exists by specified id.

    Parameters:
    Name Type Description
    id string

    Element ID

    static compile(opt)

    Compiles the specified DOM element.

    Parameters:
    Name Type Description
    opt object

    Options as below:
    {
    scope: myScope, // must be specifed. Create a new one by using Scope();
    root: DOM, // Specify the DOM element to be compiled
    cb: function() {}, // callback is called when compiling is finished
    }

    static html(opt)

    Loads an html document from the server. The server domain must be set by ar.setDomain(domain) before calling this method.

    Parameters:
    Name Type Description
    opt object

    Options as below:
    {
    scope: myScope, // must be specifed
    url: string, // Specify the url
    cb: function(div) { ... }, // callback is called when loading and compiling is finished. div is the compiled ArquesElement
    }

    static setIcon(object, shape, sizeopt, styleopt)

    Sets the embedded icon to an icon tag element

    Parameters:
    Name Type Attributes Description
    object object

    E or DOM element
    shape string

    Name of the icon. Please refer to https://material.io/icons/ for the icon names
    size integer <optional>

    Size for the icon
    style string <optional>

    CSS style string for the icon

    static isCordova() → {boolean}

    Tells if the current environment is on the Cordova.

    Returns:
    boolean -

    True if it's on the Cordova

    static isNodeJS() → {boolean}

    Tells if the current environment is on the NodeJS.

    Returns:
    boolean -

    True if it's on the NodeJS

    static isMobile() → {boolean}

    Tells if the current environment is on the mobile.

    Returns:
    boolean -

    True if it's on the mobile

    static isPC() → {boolean}

    Tells if the current environment is on the PC.

    Returns:
    boolean -

    True if it's on the PC

    static isAndroid() → {boolean}

    Tells if the current environment is on the Android.

    Returns:
    boolean -

    True if it's on the Android

    static isAndroidOld() → {boolean}

    Tells if the current environment is on the Android old version(equal or less than 5.1).

    Returns:
    boolean -

    True if it's on the Android old version

    static isIos() → {boolean}

    Tells if the current environment is on the iOS.

    Returns:
    boolean -

    True if it's on the iOS

    static isWin() → {boolean}

    Tells if the current environment is on the Windows.

    Returns:
    boolean -

    True if it's on the Windows

    static isIpad() → {boolean}

    Tells if the current environment is on the iPad.

    Returns:
    boolean -

    True if it's on the iPad

    static isTablet() → {boolean}

    Tells if the current environment is on the isTablet.

    Returns:
    boolean -

    True if it's on the isTablet

    static isFunc(v) → {boolean}

    Tells if the specified parameter is function.

    Parameters:
    Name Type Description
    v function

    A paramter to be checked
    Returns:
    boolean -

    True if it's function

    Tells if the specified parameter is number.

    Parameters:
    Name Type Description

    A paramter to be checked
    Returns:
    boolean -

    True if it's number

    Tells if the specified parameter is string.

    Parameters:
    Name Type Description
    v number

    A paramter to be checked
    Returns:
    boolean -

    True if it's string

    static isPortrait() → {boolean}

    Tells if the current window is portrait mode (by comparing width and height)

    Returns:
    boolean -

    True if it's portrait

    static ev(x, y) → {object}

    Returns a custom event of position { x, y }

    Parameters:
    Name Type Description
    x integer

    x
    y integer

    y
    Returns:
    object -

    Returns event position { x, y }

    static evPos(event) → {object}

    Returns event position { x, y }

    Parameters:
    Name Type Description
    event object

    Javascript event object
    Returns:
    object -

    Returns event position { x, y }

    static evPoses(event) → {object}

    Returns event position array [{ x, y }]

    Parameters:
    Name Type Description
    event object

    Javascript event object
    Returns:
    object -

    Returns event position array [{ x, y }]
